instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message: Hi, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has No Backlight but you can see the image with a Light flashed from Rear. There was Corrosion under the Backlight Driver Near A5 ball so I  Replaced <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> and Backlight Fuse but still no Backlight. ANY help will be GREATLY APPRECIATED...Thank You

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message:
Check continuity from A5 to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.
Pay atention to XW7720; pictures available on the forum...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message: Hi, 2informaticos Yes there is Continuity between A5 and <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message: Thanks for your Help 2informaticos...Does the screen need to be plugged in And board powered up to check the voltage on <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> and PMW ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message: Okay...With screen attached and power to board I’m getting 8.56V on both sides of F7701 but 0.001V at pin 1 and pin 2 of <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> and L7701... Also I am getting 5V on pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7710</CAPACITOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message:
Here are more measurements  with screen attached and power to board <CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR> Pin 1 0.001V

<RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR> Pin 1 (<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>) = 0.002V
<RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR> pin 2 (<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>) = 0.001V
<RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> Pin 2 <SIGNAL>BKL_PMW</SIGNAL> = 2.17V
<CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR> Pin 1 <SIGNAL>BKL_PMW</SIGNAL> = 2.17V Pin 2 = 2.17V
<RESISTOR>R7714</RESISTOR> Pin1 <SIGNAL>BKL_ISET</SIGNAL> = 0.001V
<CAPACITOR>C7711</CAPACITOR> Pin 1 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.30V
I Really Appreciate the Help :-)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> if present.

BTW, no need to measure the same line in various points...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message: Thanks Again informatics...With Screen attached and power to the board <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> Pin 5 <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> shows 3.31V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message: With Screen attached and powered on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message: Thank You Informaticos2, I Noticed <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> did not have Continuity  between Pin 2 Of <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> and TP(1) so ran a wire and all is good now Backlight Working Perfectly. Thank You So Much for all your Help :-)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight But Has image
threads.message:
Glad to hear is soved.

BTW, when you diagnose internal video issues, LCD must be connected...
